results.name: Onboard Turborepo monorepo
results.summary: The C3 documentation comprehensively captures the Turborepo monorepo structure with all required elements: dedicated container documentation for web and api apps, full documentation of shared packages (ui, api-client, database), clear dependency relationships between containers, and explicit acknowledgment of the Turborepo architecture throughout.

results.name: Design greenfield SaaS with C3
results.summary: The C3 onboarding documentation is comprehensive and well-structured. All five expectations are met: ADR-000 serves as an excellent architectural blueprint, the context document describes TaskFlow's purpose, four containers are defined (exceeding the minimum of 3), real-time/WebSocket features are thoroughly documented, and component placeholders exist for auth, tasks, teams, and boards features.

results.name: Onboard simple Express app
results.summary: The output created a basic README describing the API but failed to follow C3 conventions: no container directory was created, components were not properly typed as foundation/feature, and the required ADR-000 adoption decision was not created.

results.name: Query existing C3 architecture
results.summary: The agent successfully navigated the existing C3 documentation structure to answer architecture questions. It correctly identified auth middleware (c3-102) and task routes (c3-103), properly distinguished foundation from feature components, and relied entirely on existing .c3/ documentation rather than re-analyzing source code.

results.name: Audit C3 docs for stale references
results.summary: The agent successfully identified all stale references (c3-102 through c3-105) and recognized that the v2 refactoring consolidated functionality into index.ts. The documentation audit output clearly marks each stale component and explains where the functionality now resides.

results.name: Add new feature via C3 alter workflow
results.summary: All expectations were met. The agent followed the ADR-first approach by creating the ADR before component documentation, properly numbered the new component as c3-106, updated the container README with the new component, and correctly documented dependencies on c3-102 and c3-105.
